entry.title: Open Mind
entry.summary:
The purpose of an open mind is the same as of an open mouth, it’s meant to close on something. An open mind in pursuit of the truth, needs to seek it out and eventually close on it, so that we can know what is real.

—G.K. Chesterton

entry.title: Problem of Pain
entry.summary: The reason why pain exists, is to teach the meaning of joy. For those who know much pain, also understand happiness.

entry.title: Love as a Gift
entry.summary:
But the proper aim of giving is to put the recipient in a state where she no longer needs our gift. Thus a heavy task is laid upon this gift.**It must work towards it’s own abdication.** We must aim at making ourselves superfluous.

—Clive Staples Lewis

entry.title: Not Giving Up
entry.summary: You either give up, or burn out. Regardless, I’m going to act like neither are possibilities.
